meanings.definition: Not capable of being accomplished or carried out.
meanings.sent1: The plan to build a house made of candy was infeasible.
meanings.sent2: It was infeasible to reach the mountain peak before sunset.
meanings.sent3: Trying to teach a fish to climb a tree would be infeasible.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of flying without wings seemed infeasible but inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The idea of growing a money tree in the backyard was as infeasible as it was exciting.

meanings.sent1: It was infeasible to expect a cat to bark like a dog.
meanings.sent2: The proposal to build a bridge made of ice was infeasible.
meanings.sent3: Hoping for a rainbow to appear indoors was infeasible but amusing.
meanings.sent4: His plan to turn back time was as infeasible as stopping the sun from setting.
meanings.sent5: The thought of a car running on water alone was infeasible yet fascinating.
